name: Runic Lens
desc: 3% chance on hit to call down a meteor, dealing 2000% base damage . Every 100% attack damage dealt increases the activation chance by 3% (+3% per stack) and damage by 150% (+50% per stack) .
notes:
Runic Lens is an item in Risk of Rain 2, added in the Seekers of the Storm expansion.
When the holder hits an enemy, there is a 3% chance to summon a meteor on the target which deals 2000% base damage. For every 100% damage dealt by the initial hit, the meteor has a 3% (+3% per stack) higher chance to summon and will deal an extra 150% damage (+50% per stack) if summoned.
The meteor has a proc coefficient of 0.5


== Notes ==
This item's damage is capped at 7500%.
At 1 stack, this cap gets hit by attacks that deal 3700% damage or more.
At 2 stack, 2800% damage or more.
This item's proc chance is capped at 75%
At 1 stack, this cap gets hit by attacks that deal 2400% damage or more.
At 2 stack, 1200% damage or more.
Only one meteor per player/NPC can exist at the same time.
Although proc chains that proc the meteor cannot trigger it again, the meteor itself does not carry over previous proc chain information. This makes it possible to re-trigger earlier procs in the chain. For example, the meteor and  AtG Missile Mk. 1 can end up in an infinite feedback loop. This is most likely a bug.
Relatedly, the   SureProc buff bestowed by  Deus Ex Machina is not transferred to a proc chain after a Runic Lens meteor, meaning the meteor isn't guranteed to proc anything. This can cause wildy inconsistent damage output because of the limit of 1 meteor being active at a time.
The data about the meteor's target, damage, and impending impact are tied to the attacker's body. If this character's body is destroyed before the meteor lands, there will be no blast. The visual ring surrounding the target and implying the meteor is coming is an independent visual effect which does not trigger the explosion.
Body destruction in this case is quite literal. When a character is killed, the body object persists for a little longer to perform its death animation, during which time the meteor can still land successfully. However, respawning destroys the old body and creates a new one.
Despite the meteor visual, only the explosion on impact with the ground deals damage. Therefore, Runic Lens won't be able to damage airborne enemies that are too far from the ground.
 Breaching Fin is an anti-synergy as it will often knock enemies out of the blast area.


== Tips ==
Heavy hitting abilities like   OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike, items like  H3AD-5T v2 and equipment like  Royal Capacitor and  Preon Accumulator all have very high damage coefficient, allowing the player to get more value out of Runic Lens by increasing the chances of it proccing and the damage it does.
  OGM-72 'DIABLO' Strike is the only base damage source of damage that can hit the cap on both proc chance and damage,  H3AD-5T v2 being extremely close but falling a little short.
Crowd control items and skills such as  Sentient Meat Hook,  Primordial Cube, and   Beacon: Shocking all increase the value of Runic Lens by allowing it to hit tons of enemies at once.


== Math ==
Note: After update 1.3.6, Overspill is no longer mentioned in the Runic Lens' in-game description. This section may be outdated.
The definition of Overspill is
overspill=⌊totalDamage/baseDamage⌋
This is used to calculate the chance of proccing the item
chance=min(5+overspill×stacks,50)
When the roll is successful, the meteor summoned deals damage equal to
damage=min(20+0.5×overspill×stacks,75)
This value is calculated in terms of base damage multiples, i.e., at most it will do 7500% of base damage.
The average damage done by this attack is simply chance×damage.
